Narrative:
On May [XXX], 2024 at 11:47 AM MST a Waymo Autonomous Vehicle (Waymo AV) operating in Phoenix, Arizona was in a collision involving a utility pole in an alleyway near [XXX] and [XXX]. 
The Waymo AV was traveling north towards [XXX] down an alleyway east of [XXX] when the front of the Waymo AV made contact with a utility pole on the right side of the alleyway. At the time of the impact, the Waymo AVs Level 4 ADS was engaged in autonomous mode. The Waymo AV sustained damage.
Waymo is reporting this crash under Request No. 1 of Standing General Order 2021-01 because a vehicle involved was towed away. Waymo may supplement or correct its reporting with additional information as it may become available.

HMA was informed of this incident during a discussion with NHTSA's ODI on November [XXX], 2021. According to the information provided, a 2021 Kona EV was being operated by a non-production SAE Level 4 ADAS in an unknown mode when the Level 4 system experienced a communication error, switched to an auxiliary backup system, resulting in the vehicle crashing into a road sign/ pole.  The vehicle was undrivable post-crash.  No injuries were reported.
Hyundai notes that the subject vehicle was produced and sold with SAE Level 1 and below ADAS only.  
Hyundai also notes that it has not collaborated with Pony.ai since February 2020.
11/[XXX]/2021: No new updates available.
